cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward southeastern Louisiana, then forecast to slow, move north across Louisiana/Mississippi and turn northeast into the Tennessee–Ohio Valley by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coastline near Port Fourchon to Mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch along portions of the central Louisiana coast west of Intracoastal City (yellow on NHC cone graphic)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Mouth of the Pearl River including Lake Pontchartrain / Metropolitan New Orleans; Tropical-Storm Warning from Cameron, LA to the Alabama/Florida border (red and blue on NHC cone graphic)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas across Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not listed for Boston, MA in Advisory #11 table
weather_observation.wind: Only breezy conditions possible late in the week as remnant low passes well inland; no tropical-storm-force winds expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring periods of rain late in the week, but heavy totals not indicated in current guidance
